questions.text: Exsanguinating blood loss in:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) maximum amount of blood loss=Pelvis > femur fracture

questions.text: Name the type of traction :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Image shown is of Gallow’s traction, used for fracture SOF in child <2years age. Option B-Bryant’s traction is combination of (gallows & Bucks traction). Option C-Perkins traction is a skeletal traction Option D-Dunlop traction is used for S/C fracture humerus.

questions.text: A person with multiple injuries develops fever, restlessness, tachycardia, tachypnea and subconjunctival rash after 48 hours of injury. The likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Air embolism usually results after trauma to venous channels like external jugular vein or during neurosurgical procedures. Option B-After multiple injuries / polytrauma , fat embolism can develop usually after 48 hours with the above mentioned clinical signs and symptoms that is fever, restlessness, tachycardia, tachypnea and subconjunctival rash. Option C-Pulmonary embolism usually occurs after DVT following prolonged immobilisation. Option D-Bacterial pneumonitis presents with fever,cough with sputum production.

questions.text: Pelvic fracture most serious complication is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Fracture pelvis can lead to maximum blood loss and thus hypovolemic shock is the most serious complication. Option B-neurogenic shock occurs in injury to spinal cord. Option C-Bladder injury can occur in pelvic fracture but it is not the most serious complication. Option D-Pelvic instability can also occur but again it is not the most serious complication.

questions.text: A 60- year old female lands up in emergency with history of fall, the attitude of limb is extension and external rotation, the most probable diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Fracture NOF is a low energy trauma , occurring in elderly population with shortening, extension and ER attitude of the limb. Option B-Posterior hip dislocation –Flexion & IR attitude of hip. Option C- Intertrochanteric Fracture femur is a relatively higher energy trauma, occurring in adult (high energy)/old population (Low energy), with same but more prominent deformities compared to fracture NOF.

questions.text: 80 years old female after fall developed inability to walk, with external rotation deformity on examination. SLR is not possible and broadening of trochanter is present. The possible diagnosis is :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A,B-80 years old female with low energy trauma with ER deformity – D/D are:-fracture NOF and fracture I/T femur. But broadening of trochanter point towards fracture I/T femur. Option C-Fracture subtrochanteric femur is not very common. Option D-Fracture greater trochanter do not present with external rotation deformity.

questions.text: Which of the following fractures of the neck of femur are associated with maximal compromise in blood supply?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) More proximal the fracture is worser is the prognosis Maximal compromise of blood supply, i.e more chances of AVN : Subcapital > trans cervical >Basi cervical fracture NOF.

questions.text: Not a complication of fracture neck of femur:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Non-union is a common complication of fracture neck of femur. Option B-Malunion is not a complication of fracture NOF.Malunion is M/C complication of I/T femur fracture. Option C-AVN is a complication of fracture neck of femur. Option D- fracture neck of femur can also lead to early onset Osteoarthritis.

questions.text: Most common complication of intertrochanteric fracture femur is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Malunion is a common complication of fracture I/T femur owing to its cancellous location. Option B-Non union is a complication of fracture neck femur. Option C,D-Osteoarthritis and Nerve injury are not the Most common complication of intertrochanteric fracture femur.

choices.text: Non –union transcervical neck fracture of femur
Non –union lateral condyle fracture of humerus

questions.text: Mcmurray’s osteotomy is done for :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Mcmurray’s osteotomy is not done for Malunited intertrochanteric fracture of femur Option B-Mcmurray’s osteotomy is done for non-union transcervical fracture NOF to give it a biomechanical advantage. Option C-Milch osteotomy-Non union lateral condyle fracture of humerus. Option D-french and modified french osteotomy-Malunited supracondylar fracture of humerus.

choices.text: Closed reduction and fixation with three cancellous screws

questions.text: Fracture neck of femur in a 80 year old male sustained 1 week back.The treatment of choice is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-In fracture NOF in older population , treatment protocol is :- >60 years / active / long life expectancy / arthritic changes present – TOC is THR >60 years/ less active / life expectancy is less / no arthritic changes - then a smaller procedure like hemiarthroplasty can be done . Option B-Excision Arthroplasty is usually not done for Fracture neck of femur. Option C-Closed reduction and fixation with three cancellous screws is done in less than 60 years of age. Option D-Longitudinal skin traction for 6 weeks not done for Fracture neck of femur.

choices.text: Closed reduction and internal fixation by cancellous screws
Closed reduction and internal fixation by Austin moore pins.

questions.text: Fracture neck of femur in a 40-year old male presenting after 2 days. The treatment of choice would be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Hemiarthroplasty is done in older population with less life expectancy. Option B-Adult population - Closed reduction and internal fixation by cancellous screws (3 screws in inverted triangle pattern) is the TOC in fresh cases (<3weeks). Option C-Closed reduction and internal fixation by Austin moore pins is not done in Fracture neck of femur. Option D-Plaster and rest alone is not the mainstay of treatment.

choices.text: Plaster in abduction and internal rotation

questions.text: Trochanteric fracture of femur is best treated by:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Trochanteric fracture of femur is best treated by Dynamic hip screw. Option B,C,D-Inlay plates,Plaster in abduction and Plaster in abduction and internal rotation are not used in intertrochanteric fracture femur treatment.

questions.text: A Patient presented after RTA with following attitude of the limb. What may be the most possible diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-if the attitude of limb is flexion, adduction & internal rotation, then it is s/o posteior dislocation of hip. Option B-The attitude of limb is flexion, abduction & external rotation, s/o anterior dislocation of hip. Option C,D-Central dislocation of hip and Lateral dislocation of hip are rare entities.

choices.text: It is associated with posterior dislocation of the hip
Sciatic nerve may be involved leading to foot drop
Avascular necrosis of the hip could be a late complication
The point of impact is on the greater trochanter

questions.text: All of the following is true about dashboard injury except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The point of impact is on the knee. Injury in a flexed hip & knee producing posterior fracture dislocation of hip, patella fracture and PCL injury. Since posterior dislocation, it may be associated with sciatic nerve injury & AVN

questions.text: Type of injury in this case :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-if the attitude of limb is flexion, adduction & internal rotation, then it is s/o posteior dislocation of hip. Option B-The attitude of limb is flexion, abduction & external rotation, s/o anterior dislocation of hip. Option C-The x ray is s/o central hip dislocation with femoral head crossing the acetaublar floor of the pelvic cavity on left side. Option D-Lateral dislocation of hip is rarely seen.

questions.text: Posterior dislocation of hip can damage which nerve:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A,C-Superior gluteal and Inferior gluteal are usually not injured in Posterior dislocation of hip. Option B-Sciatic nerve is the most commonly injured nerve in posterior hip dislocation as sciatic nerve is located posteriorly. Option D-Femoral nerve is located anteriorly so will be injured in anterior dislocation of hip.

questions.text: A patient was brought to the hospital with complaints of pain around the left hip joint following a road traffic accident. On examination, the affected limb was flexed, adducted and medially rotated with obvious shortening. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-In anterior hip dislocation there is flexion, abduction and external rotation. Option B-Here, the affected limb is flexed, adducted and medially rotated so this points to posterior hip dislocation. Option C-Transcervical fracture is another name for fracture NOF,it presents with extended hip with lateral rotation of less than 45 degrees. Option D-Intertrochanteric fracture presents with extended hip with lateral rotation of more than 45 degrees.

choices.text: Closed reduction and assessment of hip stability
Open reduction and posterior pillar of acetabulum reconstruction

questions.text: 15-year-old boy was brought to the ER following a motor vehicle collision complaining of pain over the hip. The x-ray is given below. What is the next step of management?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The first step in case of dislocation is reduction So we will go for closed reduction and assessment of hip stability. Option B-CT and 3D reconstruction are not required as first step is reduction of hip joint. Option C-High weight skeletal traction can be put after closed reduction is done. Option D-Open reduction and posterior pillar of acetabulum reconstruction is not the first step,it can be done if closed reduction fails.

questions.text: Femur Shaft fracture patient comes after 2 days of fracture. He is having dyspnea and tachypnea. What is the probabale diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The shaft of femur has yellow bone marrow which has a lot of fat, now this fat can circulate and can cause fat embolism.The fat can occlude the capillaries in lungs and tissues leading to dyspnea and tachypnea. Option B-Air embolism can occur after injury to venous structure like external jugular vein. Option C-Pulmonary hypertension is not related to fracture shaft of femur. Option D-Thromboembolism can occur due to DVT due to prolonged immobilisation but in the given case scenaria fat embolism is more likely a the shaft of femur has yellow bone marrow which has a lot of fat, now this fat can circulate and can cause fat embolism
